title: Florida, West Virginia Object to Extra Funds for Some States in Opioid Deal With Purdue’s Sacklers
sub_head: Florida said $277 million that would go to states that opposed a previous opioid settlement is a side deal that violates bankruptcy law
body:
Florida and West Virginia objected to extra payments that some states would receive as part of a new $6 billion opioid-related settlement between Purdue Pharma LP’s Sackler family owners and state attorneys general.
Under the new deal, nearly $277 million was set aside to go to the eight states that opposed a previous settlement offer; the District of Columbia, which also opposed the earlier deal; and New Hampshire, according to court papers. Also, the Sackler family owners agreed to pay lawyer fees and other legal expenses for those states and the District of Columbia, according to the court papers.
